body_html:
I went through the other operators on the list (addcmul, addcdiv, baddbmm, addmv, addr) and it looks like they all have this ambiguity.

self isn't first because python_variable_method has schemas for tensor functions (i.e. tensor.addbmm(batch1, batch2, ...))

aten_schema's schemas are more like the generated/python_torch_function.cpp schemas (those have a self argument in the functions)

I'm not sure what the * is for or what the plan is to deprecate these. cc @colesbury do you know?

self isn't first because python_variable_method has schemas for tensor functions (i.e. tensor.addbmm(batch1, batch2, ...))
aten_schema's schemas are more like the generated/python_torch_function.cpp schemas (those have a self argument in the functions)
I'm not sure what the * is for or what the plan is to deprecate these. cc @colesbury do you know?
body:
I went through the other operators on the list (addcmul, addcdiv, baddbmm, addmv, addr) and it looks like they all have this ambiguity.

`self` isn't first because `python_variable_method` has schemas for tensor functions (i.e. `tensor.addbmm(batch1, batch2, ...)`)

aten_schema's schemas are more like the `generated/python_torch_function.cpp` schemas (those have a `self` argument in the functions)

I'm not sure what the * is for or what the plan is to deprecate these. cc @colesbury do you know?
